Posts.Content: Apr 3, 2008 02:35PM BKF wrote: So happy to be getting such great information!  There is so much I don't know.  I just want to be informed and smart about this. I love tennis but I also love being healthy.  Last year I broke my left arm playing so I'm not sure it's the best for me. (Maybe the man upstairs is trying to tell me something) I have already been to the LE site and found a nurse. I don't know how my insurance will handle, but I still think it's important to do.  Thanks so much!!!!! Barbara
Posts.Title: arm injury BKF BKF

Posts.Content: BKF wrote: Just wondering about treatment of arm after an apparent injury.  My right side (which I had lumpectomy, 11 nodes removed & clear, and radiation - 9 yrs. ago) elbow injury through playing tennis.  It is sore and stiff.  Should I expect it to take longer to heal because of the node removal?  What, if any, treatment should I avoid?  Cold, hot, etc.????  Should I lay off the tennis.  I truly never thought I'd play again after surgery, but lucky me, I did!  Just not sure as to how to proceed................obviously I want to play but don't want permanent damage done or lymphedema problems.  I have been so fortunate.  Thanks in advance for any help.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: arm injury BKF BKF
